Previous: kuṣNext: kūj

√kū 'design'

present: kuvate  [2.] kauti  

verbal: -kūta AV.+  -kā́vam  

derivatives: -kūti V.+  kaví V.+  kávīyas SV.  

Used only with ā, except in niṣkā́vam, the belonging of which is doubtful (as is also that of kaví). RV. has -kava, kavatnú, kavārí, 'stingy', of questionable relationship. The grammarians set up roots 1ku, 2ku or kū, 'shout', giving them a full set of forms; and Nir. once uses their intens. kokūyate.
